questions.question_text: An analyst notices changes in sales ratios when analyzing a quarterly report. Which of the following is the analyst conducting?

discussion.content:
C. A trend analysis

When an analyst notices changes in sales ratios over time, they are likely conducting a trend analysis. Trend analysis involves examining data points over a period to identify any consistent patterns, trends, or changes that may occur. In this case, the analyst is observing how sales ratios have changed from one quarter to another, which falls under the purview of trend analysis. This analysis helps in understanding the direction and magnitude of changes in sales ratios over time, which can provide valuable insights for decision-making and strategic planning.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST example of unstructured data?

discussion.content: D. Audio files like .mp4 are unstructured.

questions.question_text: A data analyst has received a data set that contains actual and projected sales for the fourth quarter of 2019. Which of the following statistical methods should the analyst use to find the measure of dispersion?

discussion.content:
B. Variance

Variance is a statistical measure of the dispersion or spread of a dataset. It quantifies how much the values in a dataset deviate from the mean. In the context of actual and projected sales for the fourth quarter of 2019, the analyst can use variance to measure the extent to which the projected sales differ from the actual sales. This measure provides insights into the variability or dispersion of the sales data, which is valuable for assessing the accuracy of the projections and understanding the potential risks or uncertainties associated with them.
